channel.title: Mac or Pixelmator anyone?
channel.description:
Okay so I was planning to start Photoshopping again after a month long break because of school and stuff but since everything's settled, I had some time on my hands so why not Photoshop?
I came about this tutorial on Abduzeedo about the torch man & I loved it. Why? Well because it's really hard to make realistic fire effects with Photoshop and although he used Pixelmator, I heard that it was just the more Mac-compatible version of PS or well has a better display than PS. Well, the stocks he provided are either paid or unavailable and I need them the most.
So like I said, I heard P/mator is sortof like PS so I wondered if anyone with a Mac OS and Pixelmator could download [url=http://tutorials.pixelmator.com/fireman/Fireman.pxm]this[/url] and post its contents individually in .psd Like the fireball, the man or you could just tell me the layers and I could tell you which ones I need. I'd really appreciate this.
EDIT: For the tut, go here - http://abduzeedo.com/torch-man-pixelmator

item.title: Mac or Pixelmator anyone?
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

sanga282:

you can use brushes to get a good fire effect, then use your layer effects and filters to make it look better, has worked well for me

I’m going for this exact tutorial but thanks dude.

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:3, topic:330586”]http://www.digitalartsonline.co.uk/tutorials/index.cfm?featureID=1879
??[/quote]
I’ve seen that tutorial also, it’s taken from Abduzeedo.

I need someone who has Mac and Pixelmator, it’s a long shot but I’m pretty sure someone can do it here…

It’s been a long time, can someone seriously help out?

Read full topic
